2. If you get into contact with a Box Jellyfish, you must react very quickly {1} this jellyfish possesses an extremely powerful venom.
3. Be {2} to have a bottle of vinegar in your first aid kit to apply to the sting.
4. Most of {3} are in the water like the Blue Ring Octopus, the Stone Fish or the White Shark.
5. But did you know that the {4} animals of the world live there as well?
6. There are also dangerous animals {5} live on land, for example snakes, reptiles and spiders.
7. While {6} around this area you should be very careful.
8. After 30 seconds, you can remove the tentacles but you will need medical aid {7}

9. Along the Great Barrier Reef, Box Jellyfish can be {8}.
10. If you come to Australia, you will see lots of unique animals there. These are animals that {9} for thousands of years, like the kangaroo, the platypus or the koala and other marsupials.

bitmark:

[%Nr. 8618]
[!Prüfung 2013/14 Realschule Sachsen]

1. And what's more, once you were inside the box everything you [+said][-say][-saying][-says] was private.
2. [-Clutch][-Clutched][-Clutches][+Clutching] their pennies they waited patiently for [-their][-there][-they][-they're] turn to be linked up to the great wide world.
3. Now there is a new generation of phone boxes [-where][+which][-who][-whose] can link you up to the Internet, receive emails, take payment [-at][-by][-in][-past] phone card or credit card. Impressive, perhaps, but where is the romance?
4. People of all types and classes would orderly [-employ][-join][+queue][-turn on] outside its red iron door.
5. In the good old days, the traditional British telephone box was a national symbol. Before mobile phones made everything so easy, the public telephone box [-are][-is][+was][-were] an important focus for community life.
6. Everybody uses mobiles nowadays, but talking loudly in [+public][-publican][-publicity][-publicly]  places with unseen faces, about personal feelings or secret dealings ... well it's not something the true British feels comfortable about!
7. For a shy people [-how][-just][+like][-so] the British it was an opportunity to meet and [-change][+exchange][-reimburse][-replace] news, gossip with neighbours and get some fresh air.
